name: Caralho
description:
Caralho (Crow's Nest) were wooden baskets placed atop the main mast, it was known as being the worst place on a vessel, due to rain, heat and shaking, which often lead to seasickness.

The captain would instruct the sailor "Vai para o caralho" (Go to the crow's nest) and from there devoleped the now widely used expression "Vai pr√≥ caralho".

Now the word is used to describe a bad place, but is used in a wide variety of contexts.
